data.text: As usual I am late to the story https://t.co/WhVaeRvThX
@K_Flynny369 Ah, it's just proselytizing. Gotta spread He/Him's word somehow!
@K_Flynny369 Are they supposed to be scientists? No one is assigned a sex at birth. How can they ask such a question?
@JeanneDeauxSays @StellaDoves I think those questions would be appropriate further into the questionnaire. Certainly it got very detailed the further I went into it.
@K_Flynny369 @StellaDoves Kind of a shame too because if someone's on cross-sex hormones, we need to know if COVID might be affecting them differently than we'd otherwise expect.

@K_Flynny369 @StellaDoves If they had asked both questions properly, it would have actually been a good way to count people who ID as transgender. Unfortunately, they used "sex" and "gender" interchangeably and incorrectly labeled intersex as both. 🙄
@K_Flynny369 Old fashioned and simple isn’t horrible. Frilly faffy questions like this, only halts science for a second. That’s all.
@PucatuB Playing the devil’s advocate if they asked the old fashioned sex question the idiots would treat this as a free for all. You’re right - the second question is obsolete 😂
